intro: Stichorkis luteola, commonly known as the yellow stichorkis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in open areas with full sun exposure. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
